arabian.text: The monkey looks into the mirror and sees a gazelle.
An army of sheep led by a lion would defeat an army of lions led by a sheep.
arabian.description: Leadership is the most important factor in success.

arabian.text: Ask your purse what you can buy.
arabian.description: Don’t spend more money than you have.

arabian.text: Excuses are worse than the original fault.
arabian.description: Making excuses for a mistake is worse than the mistake itself.

arabian.text: If you build a pit for an enemy, you will fall into it.
arabian.description: Unkind actions will ultimately harm the person doing them.

arabian.text: Secrets are like birds; when they leave your hand, they take flight.
arabian.description: You can’t control who knows a secret after you’ve told it to someone.

arabian.text: The fruit of timidity is neither gain, nor loss.
arabian.description: If you don’t stand up for what you believe in, nothing will change.

arabian.text: Time is money.
arabian.description: Wasting time is wasting a valuable resource.

arabian.text: What is learned in youth is carved in stone.
arabian.description: Childhood experiences affect a person forever.

arabian.text: Dwell not upon thy weariness, thy strength shall be according to the measure of thy desire.
Examine what is said, not him who speaks.
If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart.
Make your bargain before beginning to plow.
An army of sheep led by a lion would defeat an army of lions led by a sheep
Do good and throw it in the sea.
If you have much, give of your wealth; if you have little, give of your heart
Sunshine all the time makes a desert.
Even this shall pass away.
The quickest generosity is the best.
If you have much give of your wealth, if you have little give of your heart.
He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has everything.
The hasty and the slow meet at the ferry.
Silk was invented so that woman could go naked in clothes.
The dry reed does not seek the company of the fire.
Live together like brothers and do business like strangers.
Beauty is power.
Wrath begins in madness and ends in repentance.
If a man thinks well of you, make his thought come true.
On the day of victory no one is tired.
If the camel once get his nose in a tent, the body will soon follow.
If the cap fits, wear it.
If the camel once gets his nose in a tent, his body will soon follow.
A secret is like a dove: when it leaves my hand it takes wing.
A sense of humor is the pole that adds balance to our steps as we walk the tightrope of life.
A small tumbledown house is better than a communal palace.
A sponge to wipe away the past; a rose to sweeten the present; a kiss to greet the future.
A thousand curses never tore a shirt.
A wise man associating with the vicious becomes an idiot; a dog traveling with good men becomes a rational being.
A wise man's day is worth a fool's life.
A woman's belly is a garden with many kinds of fruit.
A woman's mosque is her home.
Act like you are an idiot and everyone will respect you.
A friend advises in his interest, not yours.
A friend is known when needed.
A good deed dies when it is spoken about.
A good man is one who rejoices in the well-being of others.
A good orator makes us see with our ears.
A grateful dog has more worth than an ungrateful man.
A hand that has been chopped off cannot steal any more.
A heart free from care is better than a full purse.
A horse of good breed is not dishonored by his saddle.
A horse that will not carry a saddle must have no oats.
Ask for your wife's advice and then do the opposite.
Ask me what are my virtues, not about the color of my skin.
Ask the experienced rather than the learned.
Ask thy purse what thou should'st buy.
At the narrow passage there is no brother and no friend.
Attend funerals avoid weddings.
Be sure to have a controversial opinion, and men will talk about you.
Beauty doesn't exist, men only dream it.
Beauty never travels in a group.
Most people forget everything except being ungrateful.
Moustaches hide the imperfections of the mouth.
My debtor is a worse payer even than I am.
Never celebrate someone's leaving, until you know who will succeed him.
Never give advice in a crowd.
Never sit in the place of a man who can say to you, "Rise.".
Never speak ill of the dead.
Never tell your friends what your enemy may not hear.
Never trust a fool with a sword.
No crowd ever waited at the gates of patience.
The best part of repentance is a little sinning.
The chameleon does not leave one tree until he is sure of another.
The corn will bend but it still ends up in the mill.
The cure for bad times is patience.
The dawn does not come twice to awaken a man.
The devil tempts all men, but idle men tempt the devil.
The different sorts of madness are innumerable.
The difficult is done at once, the impossible takes a little longer.
The dogs bark, but the caravan moves on.
The dogs may bark but the caravan moves on.
A book is a garden carried in the pocket.
A book is like a garden carried in the pocket.
A book that remains shut, is but a block.
A borrowed cloak does not keep one warm.
A chameleon does not leave one tree until he is sure of another.
A change is as good as a rest.
A fable is a bridge that leads to truth.
A fable is a bridge which leads to truth.
A fat woman is a blanket for the winter.
A foolish man may be known by six things: Anger without cause, speech without profit, change without progress, inquiry without object, putting trust in a stranger, and mistaking foes for friends.
Love sees clearly, hate even more so, but jealousy sees the most clear, because it is equal to love plus hate.
Lying and stealing are next door neighbors.
Make do with bread and butter until God can bring you jam.
Man is like a palm on the beach; moving with the wind of life.
Man was created in a hurry.
Mankind is made out of forgetfulness.
Many are the roads that do not lead to the heart.
Marriage is like a besieged castle; those who are on the outside wish to get in; and those who are on the inside wish to get out.
Meaningless laughter is a sign of ill-breeding.
If you give in to a fool, he will say, "This is because they are afraid of me."
If you have given away much of your wealth, then you have given a little of your heart.
If you have never seen evil, look closely at yourself some time.
If you hear that a mountain has moved, believe; but if you hear that a man has changed his character, believe it not.
If you stop every time a dog barks, your road will never end.
If you want to hit your mother-in-law, be sure to split her head.
If you want to kill a snake, chop off its head.
If you want to take revenge on a man, send him a really beautiful woman.
If your neighbor visits Mecca once, watch out for him. If he makes a second visit, you had better avoid him. After the third visit you had better move to another street.
Example is better than precept.
Excuses are always mixed with lies.
Experiences are the spectacles of intellect.
Fate loves a rebel.
Fear not the man who fears God.
Fear the person who fears you.
Follow the advice of the one who makes you cry, not from the one who makes you laugh.
Forgiveness is more satisfying than revenge.
Four things come not back -- the spoken word, the sped arrow, the past life, and the neglected opportunity.
Give a man some cloth and he'll ask for some lining.
Give me wool and tomorrow you will have a sheep.
Go and wake up your cook.
God bless him who pays visits -- short visits.
God gave the giraffe a long neck so that He would not have to bend the palm tree.
God grant us no neighbor with two eyes.
God has spared the naked man from washing his clothes with soap.
God sells knowledge for labor -- honor for risk.
Good deeds banish bad ones.
Good qualities never cancel out the bad, just as sugar is no antidote for poison.
If someone says "There is a wedding ceremony in the clouds," then the women would soon arrive with their ladders.
IF the camel once gets his nose in the tent, his body will soon follow.
If the king says that it is night in the middle of the day, look up at the stars.
If there were no tears, our ribs would burn.
If we are both masters, then who shall lead the mules?
If you are a friend of the captain, you can wipe your hands on the sail.
If you are offered a bull, do not ask how much milk he will give.
If you buy cheap meat, you'll smell what you have saved when it boils.
If you cannot take things by the head, then take them by the tail.
If you don't know where you are going, look back to where you've come from.
Even the one-eyed man winks to women.
Every age has its book.
Every ambitious man is a captive and every covetous one a pauper.
Every day of your life is a page of your history.
Every dog is a great barker at the door of his own house.
Every future is not far away.
Every head has its own kind of headache.
Every sun has to set.
Everything is small at the beginning and then grows; except trouble, which is big at the beginning and still grows.
Evil people know one another.
If a dog offers to help you across the river, don't ask if he is suffering from the mange.
If a man believes in a stone, that stone will serve him well.
If a man's mouth were silent, then another part would speak.
If a poor man ate it, they would say it was because of his stupidity.
If a rich man ate a snake, they would say it was because of his wisdom; if a poor man ate it, they would say it was because of his stupidity.
If a wife is unfaithful then the husband is partly to blame.
If begging should unfortunately be your lot, knock at the large gates only.
If I had two loaves of bread, I would sell one and buy hyacinths, for they would feed my soul.
If man be a river, then woman will be a bridge.
If power is for sale, sell your mother to buy it. You can always buy her back again.
Great care is no defense against Fate.
Habit is the sixth sense that dominates the other five.
Haste is the invention of the devil.
He fasted for a whole year and then broke his fast with an onion.
He fled from the rain and sat down under the waterspout.
He gets his passage for nothing and then winks at the captain's wife.
He hit me, started to cry, and went straight to the judge to sue me.
He left us and we rejoiced; then an even more unbearable person came.
He promised me earrings, but then only pierced my ears.
He that counts his friend's mistakes will be abandoned by him.
He that has long legs will go far.
He that has no money has no friends.
He that plants thorns must never expect to gather roses.
He who eats alone chokes alone.
He who foretells the future lies, even if he tells the truth.
He who has approved of wrongdoing is as guilty as he who has committed it.
He who has been bitten by a snake is scared of a rope on the ground.
He who has health has hope, and he who has hope has every thing.
He who has health has hope; and he who has hope, has everything.
He who is a slave of truth is a free man.
Both the fast and the slow will meet each other on the ferry boat.
Bravery without intelligence is not bravery.
Call someone your lord and he'll sell you in the slave market.
Children are buttonholes that hold their parents together.
Choose your neighbor before your house and your companion before the road.
Compete, don't envy.
Conversation is like making love; the man is the question, the woman the answer, and the union of both will bear fruit.
Curses are like young chickens, And still come home to roost.
Dawn does not come to awaken a man a second time.
Dawn does not come twice to awaken a man.
Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
Lending nourishes bad feeling.
Let the sword decide only after the plan has failed.
Lies are accepted once, not twice.
Life, like a fire, begins in smoke and ends in ashes.
Light your lamp first at home and afterwards at the mosque.
Look and keep silent, and if you are eating meat, tell the world it's fish.
Love lasts as long as does the reproach.
Love makes a man both blind and deaf.
He who starts a lawsuit makes a hole in the dike.
He who steals an egg will steal a camel.
He who uses bad incense must be careful not to burn his sleeves.
He who walks alone shall surely arrive first.
He who walks through a field of onions, will smell like an onion.
He who wants to sell his honor will always find a buyer.
He who would visit a vice, never has far to travel.
Heaven on earth is to be found on horseback, reading books and between a woman's breasts.
I am a prince and you are a prince; who will lead the donkeys?.
I came to the place of my birth and cried, "The friends of my youth, where are they?" And echo answered, "Where are they?"
In order to really love someone you must love him as though he was going to die tomorrow.
In the desert of life the wise travel by caravan, while the fool prefers to travel alone.
In the presence of Fate, the physician becomes a fool.
In the small lanes there are no brothers or friends.
Insults must be written in sand and compliments carved in stone.
It is a sign of weakness just to let things happen.
It is better to cut off the head that has no pride.
It is better to die in revenge than to live on in shame.
It is easier not to commit a sin than to repent it.
It is good to know the truth and to speak the truth. It is even better to know the truth and speak about palm trees.

He who knows not and knows not that he knows not is a fool. Shun him. He who knows not and knows that he knows not is a child. Teach him. He who knows and knows not that he knows is asleep. Wake him. He who knows and knows that he knows is a wise man. Follow him.
He who lies for you will lie about you.
He who lives in a glass house should not throw stones.
He who looks up too much gets a pain in the neck.
He who loves thinks that the others are blind; the others think that he is crazy.
He who only thinks about what is in his belly is worth less than what comes out of it.
He who peeps at the neighbor's window may chance to lose his eyes.
He who plants thorns must never expect to gather roses.
He who predicts the future lies, even if he tells the truth.
He who sees the calamity of other people finds his own calamity light.
An eloquent cock crows as soon as it comes out of the egg.
An imbecile can manage his own affairs better than a wise man the affairs of other people.
An insult is but a short garment: it reveals the one who wears it.
An old lion will be mocked by the dogs.
An unjust king is like a river without water.
Another man's bread will not fill your belly.
Any water in the desert will do.
Arrogance diminishes wisdom.
Arrogance is a weed that grows mostly on a dunghill.
Ask advice of an ignorant man and he will think you are his enemy.
A house divided cannot stand.
A kind speech and forgiveness is better than alms followed by injury.
A kind word can attract even the snake from his nest.
A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
A lazy man will be an astrologer.
A learned man without work is a cloud without rain.
A little and a little, collected together, becomes a great deal; the heap in the barn consists of single grains, and drop and rop makes an inundation.
A little bird wants but a little nest.
A little body doth often harbour a great soul.
A little debt makes a debtor, a great one an enemy.
It is good to know the truth, but it is better to speak of palm trees.
It is not the bullet that kills you, it is fate.
It makes no sense to try to forge the iron whilst it is still cold.
It may be a fire today -- tomorrow it will be ashes.
It's all fate and chance.
Judge a man by the reputation of his enemies.
Judge not of a ship as she lies on the stocks.
Kiss the hand of your enemy if you cannot chop it off: Envy has no rest.
Know each other as if your were brothers; negotiate deals as if you were strangers to each other.
Knowledge acquired as a child is more lasting than an engraving on stone.
Believe what you see and lay aside what you hear.
Better a handful of dry dates and content therewith than to own the Gate of Peacocks and be kicked in the eye by a broody camel.
Better a thousand enemies outside the tent than one within.
Better make profit out of manure than losses with musk.
Better to be a free dog than a caged lion.
Better to have bread and an onion with peace than stuffed fowl with strife.
Beware of one who flatters unduly; he will also censure unjustly.
Beware the man who lavishes too much praise on you, he will later run you down.
Beware: some liars tell the truth.
Blind eyes see better than blind hearts.
Do not stand in a dangerous place trusting in miracles.
Do not stand in a place of danger trusting in miracles.
Do not tell a friend anything you would conceal from an enemy.
Do not tell secrets in front of servants.
Don't pour away your water on the strength of a mirage.
Don't think you are eloquent just because a fool applauds you.
Doubt is the key to all knowledge.
Eat whatever thou likest, but dress as others do.
Eat whatever you like, but dress as others do.
Youth is a kind of illness cured only by the passing years.
Youths are like waves of the sea, the elderly have strength instead of tide.
Death is a black camel that lies down at every door. Sooner or later you must ride the camel.
Death is a black camel which kneels at every man's gate.
Death rides a fast camel.
Death was afraid of him because he had the heart of a lion.
Diligence is a great teacher.
Diligence is the mother of good luck.
Discord between the powerful is a fortune for the poor.
Do not buy either the moon or the news, for in the end they will both come out.
Do not cut down the tree that gives you shade.
Do not ridicule the thin-bearded when you yourself have no beard.
A man cannot be a good physician if he has never been sick himself.
A man profits more by the sight of an idiot than by the orations of the learned.
A man who was always complaining was quite rightly sent to hell. "Why are you burning damp wood?" was his first comment.
A man's worth depends on his two smallest organs: his heart and his tongue.
A mouth that praises and a hand that kills.
A mule can go to Mecca, but it will not come back as a pilgrim.
A mule who goes in search of a fine set of antlers, will come back with his ears cut off.
A poor man would like to have some fun, but he cannot find the right place.
A promise is a cloud; fulfillment is the rain.
A scholar's ink is worth as much as the blood of the martyr.
Silence is a brother of delight.
Silence is a cure for grief.
Silence is the best answer to the stupid. The fool has his answer on the tip of his tongue.
Silence is the interpreter of happiness.
Sinning is the best part of repentance.
Sins of omission are seldom fun.
So long as I can keep a secret it is my prisoner. If I let it slip then I am its prisoner.
So long as the pot is boiling, friendship will stay warm.
Sometimes even the intestine and the stomach disagree.
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
No cure, no pay.
No man is a good physician who has never been sick.
None but a mule denies his family.
Not to use trickery is also trickery.
Nothing but a handful of dust will fill the eyes of man.
Obedience to a woman leads to hell.
Older than you by a day, wiser than you by a year.
On the first of March, the crows begin to search.
Once you have decided to hit someone, then hit them hard because the retribution will be the same whether you hit hard or not.
The doorstep weeps for forty days whenever a girl is born.
The dreams of a cat are full of mice.
The dry reed does not seek the company of fire.
The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
The English are a nation of shopkeepers.
The excess of one is the shortage of another.
The eyes are of little use if the mind be blind.
The fire is winter's fruit.
The first will get the credit, even if the second is better.
The fool has his answer on the tip of his tongue.
Advice given in the midst of a crowd is loathsome.
After dinner, rest; after supper walk a mile.
After lunch, rest; after dinner take a walk.
All earthly goods we have only on loan.
All kinds of fame belong partly to others.
All mankind is divided into three classes: those that are immoveable, those that are moveable, and those that move.
All sunchine makes the desert.
All sunshine makes the desert.
Allah does not love the aggressors.
The ink of a scholar is worth as much as the martyr's blood.
The knife of the family does not cut.
The liar's mother is a virgin.
The lion said: I am the best one to take care of my business.
The man with no patience waits for daylight, and when it comes he'll be blind.
The men are the wool of the tribe, but the women are the ones who weave the pattern.
The mind is for seeing, the heart is for hearing.
The most useful holy war is the one fought against your own passions.
The mother of someone who is killed can sleep; the mother of the murderer cannot.
The wound that bleedeth inwardly is the most dangerous.
The wrath of brothers is fierce and devilish.
The young goose is a good swimmer.
There are five ways in which to become wise: be silent, listen, remember, grow older and study.
There are four things Allah cannot do: lie, deny himself, die or look favorably on sin.
There are some words that look like salted jam.
There are two kinds of men: those who could be happy and are not, and those who search for happiness and find it not.
There has to be a first time for everything -- even our most natural habits.
There is no greater misfortune than your own.
They have sowed the seed of the word "tomorrow" and it has not germinated.
Trust in Allah, but tie up your camel.
Trust in God, but tie your camel.
Trust makes way for treachery.
Two scorpions living in the same hole will get along better than two sisters in the same house.
Two weaklings conquered the fort.
Unfortunate is the man who has no fingernails to scratch his head with.
Unwrapping a gift wraps up enmity.
Visit infrequently, and you will get closer.
Visit rarely, and you will be more loved.
Walls are the notebooks of fools.
The strength of the heart comes from the soundness of the faith.
The tongue of experience utters the most truth.
The tree of silence bears the fruits of peace.
The whisper of a pretty girl can be heard further off than the roar of a lion.
The word of the king is the king of words.
The words of the elderly are as sweet as honey, but if you do not listen they become as sour as bile.
The words of tongue should have three gate keepers.
The world is like carrion; those who love and eat from it are dogs.
The worst things in life are: To be in bed and sleep not, To want for one who comes not, To try to please and please not.
The wound of words is worse than the wound of swords.
You are like a tree, giving your shade to the outside.
You can always find good elements in the misfortune that strikes you.
You cannot carry two watermelons in one hand.
You know a man by the sweat of his brow and the strength of his word.
You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
You only own that which you have earned.
You will get no nourishment from the flesh of a woman.
You won't gain knowledge by drinking ink.
Your friend will swallow your mistakes, your enemy will present them on a plate.
Your tongue is like a horse -- if you take care of it, it takes care of you; if you treat it badly, it treats you badly.
Think of the going out before you enter.
Those who argue with each other on the highway will often make up in the lane.
Those who foretell the future lies, even if he tells the truth.
Throw a lucky man in the sea, and he will come up with a fish in his mouth.
Throw dirt enough, and some will stick.
Throw him into the river and he will come up with a fish in his mouth.
Time is the master of him who has no master.
To threaten the brave with death is like promising water to a duck.
To you your religion and to me my religion.
Trees often transplanted never prosper.
War is a disaster for winner and loser alike.
What is learnt in the cradle lasts to the grave.
What the wolf mourns is food for the fox.
What wise men suppose is worth more than the certainties of fools.
When a door opens not to your knock, consider your reputation.
When a rich man wants children, he gets dollars, when a poor man wants dollars, he gets children.
When danger approaches, sing to it.
When God shuts one door, He opens another.
When God wishes a man well, He gives him insight into his faults.
Whoever knew you when you were small will not respect you when you're big.
Whoever knows how to use a pen never adds his own name to the "guilty" list.
Whoever lives within himself is burning with love.
Wisdom consists of ten parts -- nine parts of silence and one part with few words.
Wishing does not make a poor man rich.
Wit is folly unless a wise man hath the keeping of it.
Without the companionship even paradise would be boring.
Words from the heart reach the heart, words from the mouth reach the ear.
Write the bad things that are done to you in sand, but write the good things that happen to you on a piece of marble.
Measure your guilt, then stretch your legs.
Meat and mass never hindered man.
Men fear, but time fears the pyramids.
Men laugh with their heart, women only with their mouth.
Men learn little from success, but much from failure.
Men must sew up tears with gentleness.
Misfortune is easier to bear if you share it with many others.
Mistrust before you trust.
Money can build roads in the sea.
More than one war has been caused by a single word.
When the judge's mule dies, everyone goes to the funeral; when the judge himself dies, no one does.
When what you want doesn't happen, learn to want what does.
When you die, your sister's tears will dry as time goes on, your widow's tears will end in another's arms, but your mother will mourn you until the day she dies.
When you have spoken the word, it reigns over you. When it is unspoken you reign over it.
When you shoot an arrow of truth, dip its point in honey.
When your enemies attack, bathe in their blood.
Where there are poor, there are rich. But where there is justice, they are all brothers.
Where there is a will there is a way. Where there is no will there is an excuse.
Who does not choose dies of hunger.
Who does not go with you, go with him.
Once you have found your rhythm, you will then know your God.
One coin in the money box makes more noise than when it is full.
One coin in the money-box makes more noise than when it is full.
One day in perfect health is a lot.
One hand cannot applaud.
One hand for oneself and one for the ship.
One is not born a warrior, you become one.
Only a mother can understand the suffering of a son.
Only death itself can end our hope.
Only he who understands is really sad.
Spurs that are too sharp make even the mule rear.
Sunshine without rain makes a desert.
Talent without skill is like a desert without an oasis.
The angry hammer works off his fury on the steel.
The ass went seeking for horns and lost his ears.
The awakening of a giant shakes the world.
The barber learns to shave on the orphan's face.
The benefits you get become the debts you owe to others.
The best act of generosity is that which is quickly done.
Reproaches are the soap of the heart.
Righteousness is half of religion.
Salt will never be worm-eaten.
Search knowledge though it be in China.
Seek counsel of him who makes you weep, and not of him who makes you laugh.
Seven days king, seven days minister, slave for the rest of your life.
Seven trades but no luck.
Shall the gosling teach the goose to swim?
Shallow waters mak' maist din.
Show no fear to the man who picks up a big stone.
The fruit of silence is tranquility.
The fruit of timidity is neither gain nor loss.
The frying-pan says to the kettle, "Avaunt, black brows!"
The grave is our mother.
The greatest tranquility is when we desire nothing.
The hand of God is with the group.
The hasty and the tardy meet at the ferry.
The hasty angler loses the fish.
The hasty hand catches frogs for fish.
The house of danger is built upon the borders of safety.
The mouth of a canon is less dangerous than that of a scandalmonger.
The nail supports the hoof, the hoof the horse, the horse the man, the man the world.
The one-eyed person is a beauty in the country of the blind.
The poor always smell.
The rope of a lie is short.
The sinning is the best part of repentance.
The slave must be content with the joys of his master.
The soul of a fool is always dancing on the tip of his tongue.
The soul of an idiot is always dancing on the end of his tongue.
The soul will only be at rest when it stops hoping.
Only the tent pitched by your own hands will stand.
Only three things in life are certain birth, death and change.
Pardon is the choicest flower of victory.
Patience is beautiful.
Peace is only possible after war.
Play alone and you're bound to win.
Proverbs are the lamp of speech.
A promise is a cloud; fulfillment is rain.
A wise man associating with the vicious becomes an idiot; a dog travelling with good men becomes a rational being.
All mankind is divided into three classes: those that are immovable, those that are moveable, and those that move.
All strangers are relations to each other.
All sunshine makes a desert.
Example is better than law.
Fortune is with you for an hour, and against you for ten.
God sells knowledge for labour -- honour for risk.
Good to sell knowledge for labor, honor for risk.
Greed lessens what is gathered.
He who has health, has hope. And he who has hope, has everything.
Don't celebrate someone's departing unless you know who will succeed him.
Don't pour away your water due to a mirage.
Examine what is said, not who is speaking.
Let the sword decide after the stratagem has failed.
The person who predicts the future is lying, even when he is right.
The tree of silence bears the fruit of peace.
The whisper of a pretty girl can be heard further than the roar of a lion.
There are no fans in hell.
There has to be a first time for everything -- even the most natural habits.
A little and a little, collected together, becomes a great deal; the heap in the barn consists of single grains, and drop and drop makes an inundation.
Better a hundred enemies outside the house than one inside.
Cleanse thy heart from greed, and thy foot shall remain free from fetters.
He who has health, has hope; and he who has hope, has everything.
He who speaks about the future lies, even when he tells the truth.

He who wants to sell his honor will always find a buyer. The garlic complained to the onion, "You stink!" If you count your friend's mistakes, he will desert you. Many wars have been caused by a single word.
How can the person who is eating dates prohibit the eating of dates? It's better to be a free dog than a caged lion.
How tight can life be without the space of hope.
If begging should unfortunately be thy lot, knock at the large gates only.
If I were to trade in winding sheets, no one would die.
If the camel once get his nose in the tent, his body will follow.
If you buy cheap meat, when it boils you smell what you have saved.
If you don't know where you are going, then look back to where you have come from.
It's better to have a thousand enemies outside of the tent than one inside the tent.
They wooed her and she resisted; they neglected her and she fell in love.
Throw a lucky man into the sea, and he will come up with a fish in his mouth.
Throw a resourceful person into a river, and he will probably come out with a fish in his hand.
Today it may be a fire, tomorrow it will be ashes.
Trust Allah, but tie up your camel.
When you are an anvil be patient; when a hammer, strike
Who works achieves and who sows reaps.
Wisdom consists of ten parts: nine parts silence, and one part a few words.
The barber learns his trade on the orphan's chin.
One is better off seated than standing. lying than seated, asleep than awake, and dead than alive.
Patience is the key of joy; but haste is the key to sorrow.
Prayer is the pillow of religion.
A bite from a lion is better the look of envy.
A debacle demolishes the will.
A god-given beauty needs no beautician.
A good advice is part of the Religion..
A horse can trip.
Be generous to a generous person and you'd win him, be generous to a mean person and he'd rebel on you.
Beat the iron while it is hot.
Beating the dead is a sin.
Believe what you see and not all you hear.
Better a thousand enemies outside the house than one inside.
Better late than never.
arabian.description: It’s best to do something on time. But if you can’t do it on time, do it late.

arabian.text: Better safe than sorry.
Beware of he whose goodness you can't ask for for and whose evil you can't be protected from.
Arrogance over the arrogant is modesty.
Ask for a science that would be useful to you, would keep you from harm and shame, then elevate you.
Ate and praised is better than ate and was silence.
Avoid the company of a liar. And if you can't avoid him, don't believe him.
Avoid what will require an apology.
Be aware of the idiot, for he is like an old dress. Every time you patch it, the wind will tear it back again.
Be careful of your enemy once and of your friend a thousand times, for a double crossing friend knows more evil.
Dogs bark, but the caravan moves on.
Don't ask the singer to sing until he wishes to sing by himself.
Don't delay today's work until tomorrow.
Don't eat your bread on someone else's table.
Don't neglect the consequence of your act.
Don't pride over your wealth or beauty, one will be gone in a night and the other with a fever.
Don't send an old man to buy a donkey, nor a young man to woo a wife.
Dust does not burden him.
A tree starts with a seed.
A word to the wise is sufficient.
Account by the dinar, give charity by the ass load.
Actions speak louder than words.
arabian.description: You are judged more by what you do than what you say. Your actions are proof to the things you say.

arabian.text: Advice sharpens a rusty opinion.
Afar, it enraptures the heart, when near, it rends the gallbladder.
Afraid of one's shadow.
Each hajji goes to mecca his own way.
Eat less food to find more sleep.
Eat your bread with water and don't ask for another's dough.
Eats more than a fire.
Eats more than a whale.
Envy is a weight not placed by its bearer.
God's hand is with those who work in groups.
Goha said to his son that he wont sleep beside him. Said: Saved us your farts.
Good manners is the greatest friend.
Grapes and grapes.
Had the monkey seen its ass, it wouldn't have danced.
hands are loans.
Has a better voice than a pigeon.
Have patience and you'll get what you want.
He beat me and cried, and went before me to complain.
He builds a castle by demolishing a country.
A nod for a wise man, and a rod for a fool.
A person who does not speak out against the wrong is a mute devil.
A problem is solved when it gets tougher.
A promise is a cloud; fulfillment is rain; and the best promise is that which has been proved by rain.
A servant who has two masters, lies to one of them.
A throw without a thrower.
Darker than the night.
days are countries.
Death is a camel which sleeps in everyone's house.
dig a well then close the well, but do not fire a worker.
Dissent and you will be known.
Distance is disaffection.
Do good and throw it in sea.
Do good and throw it in the tigris and god will repay you in the desert.
Do good to people in order to enslave their hearts.
Experimenting is the great science.
Falseness lasts an hour, and truth lasts till the end of time.
Faster than an arrow.
Faster than death.
Faster than eye blink.
Faster than lightning.
Faster than the wind.
Faster than thoughts.
Fire could leave ashes behind.
Fire is more bearable than disgrace.
Cheaper than dates in Basra.
Cleanliness is out of faith.
Close the door from which the wind blows and relax.
Closer than the carotid artery.
Closer than the closeness of the teeth to the tongue.
Complaining is the weak's weapon.
Complaining to someone other than God is disgraceful.
Consult the wise and do not disobey him.
Content is an everlasting treasure.
Cooler than ice.
A horse which is tamed at forty is only good for resurrection day.
A lion on me and an ostritch in war.
A lot got the crow to his mother.
A monkey that amuses me is better than a deer astray.
A mosquito can make the lion's eye bleed.
A mother is a school, preparing her is like preparing a good nation.
Get together like brother, and keep each other in check like strangers.
Give your friend your blood and money.
Gnats, in great number, can beat an elephant.
Go softly, come softly, so that the cat does not gore you.
God creates people with the same looks.
God gives time but doesn't ignore.
God helps those who help themselves.
God sends clothes to those with no proper figure, and bread to those with no teeth.
Among the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
An excellent appearance, an empty pocket.
An excuse is sometime more ugly than a guilt.
An ugly woman's husband better be blind.
An unshod mocks a shoe.
Older than you by a day, more knowledgeable than you by a year.
One day is for us, and the other is against us.
One hand can't hold two watermelons.
One hand cannot clap.
Laughing for no reason is rude.
Leading by example is better than giving and advice.
Leave evil, it will leave you.
Lies are the plague of speech.
Life is a dogma and a fight for the dogma.
Life is made of two days. One which is sweet and the other is bitter.
Life will show you what you did not know.
Life without a friend is death without a witness.
Like a deaf man in a parade.
Like a fish in water.
Money is a Cure.
More awake than a wolf.
More careful than an ant.
More cautious than a crow.
More cursed than Abi Lahab.
More desperate than a drowning person.
More enduring than a donkey.
More fair than scales.
More fake than a mirage.
More famous than a fire on a flag.
Literal meaning: The friend in tight times.
Literal meaning: The gauge has overflown.
Literal meaning: The people's lord is their servant.
Literal meaning: The sultan's sword is long.
longer than a sepration day.
Longer than the winter's night.
Love is blind.
Loving your country is pious.
Luck in the sky and brains in the ground.
I have sifted my flour and hung up the sieve.
I saw people tending to the one who has money.
I taught him archery everyday, and when he got good at it he throw an arrow at me.
I tell no, I don't you no but the habit in you prevails. AND the tail of the dog never straightens up even if you hang to it a brick.
I'm already drowning so why should I fear getting wet?
I'm up to it and to any great thing.
Idiomatic translation: A penny saved is a penny earned.
If a wind blows, ride it.
If an eagle is no good, cut it's feathers off.
youth and void and edginess ruin men.
Birds of a feather flock together.
arabian.description: People like to spend time with others who are similar to them.

arabian.text: Blame comes before swords.
Blood can never turn into water.
Bolder than a rooster.
branches straighten.
Brighter than a peacock.
Burial is the way to honor the dead.
Came back with Hunain's shoes. meaning: Came back with nothing.
Charity is a silent prayer.
He who sows the wind harvests the storm.
He who spits up in the air will get it back on his beard.
He who was left by the bald is taken by the hairy.
He whose ace gets cut on, gets his underpants off. When you cut, cut high. The Third Hand is the highest hand.
He's hardly a sour grape, yet behaves like a raisin.
Heard the question wrong, answered wrong.
He Said where are you going grape, She sighed�: I am staying on the couch.
He sold his vinyard and bought a squeezer.
He steals the mascara from her eyes.
He that sows the wind shall reap the whirlwind.
He walks slowly and arrives first.
He who does not know the falcon would grill it.
He who does not know you is not informed of you.
He who got out of his home lessened his value.
He who is free to do what he wants will use his hand as a balance.
They were two, but united; we were a hundred, but divided.
They whom got shy, died.
This cub is from that lion.
This dead person is not worth all of this grief.
Those who are far from the eye are far from the heart.
Though pepper is a tiny thing, its taste is mighty powerful.
Thought he was a great catch, turns out he is a shackle.
Threaten him with death so that he may be content with fever.
Three things to fear: a crumbling wall, an angry dog, and a shrew.
Tie your camel and rely on God.
Tighter than a needle's eye.
Time has eaten and drank upon it.
Time is like a sword. If you did not cut it, it will cut you.
Time is made of gold.
To put taghi's hat on naghi's head.
To sit by the ring and tell the man inside, 'knock him down.'
Today is wine, and tomorrow is an assignment. Today we will drink wine, and tomorrow we will work hard.
Tomorrow is close if you wait it.
Tomorrow we sit by the wall and here it all.
More hideous than the disappearence of good fortune.
More jinxed than Al Basoos.
More kindhearted than a mother to her children.
more lost then the winter moon.
More observant than a bat.
More observant than a crow.
More permanent than a tattoo.
More pure than a tear.
more robust than the nose of a lion.
More sad than Al Khansaa' for Sakhr.
More fearful than an ostrich.
more flirty than oumrou'o al kayss.
More fluent than Qas Bin Sa'ida.
More generous than Hatim.
More greedy than Asha'ab.
More handy than a silk worm.
More hideous than a monkey.
More hideous than a pig.
More hideous than a say without a do.
More hideous than an ogre.
The best of the things you own, is what is useful to you.
The best place in the world is on the back of a horse, and the best thing to do in time is to read a book.
The best thing is the newest thing.
The best to sit with in all times is a book.
The carpenter's door is loose.
the crown of ... is modesty.
the cure for fate is patience.
The day of happiness is short.
The deserter is the brother of the murderer.
the destiny of a coward comes from over him.
If there's no choice but advice, ask for the decisiveness of an advisor or the advice of a decisive person.
If thy beloved was honey, don't lick all of him.
If two thieves quarreled, what was stolen emerges.
If you are saved from the lion, do not be greedy and hunt it.
If you are to hit then make it painful, because you'll get one blame eitherways.
If you can't reward then you should thank.
If you conduct yourself properly, fear no one.
If you don't want to be disgraced, do as others do.
If you dress in gold or silk, you are still the same green grocer.
Fire will burn itself out if it did not find anything to burn.
Fixing the known is better than waiting for the unknown.
Follows more than a shadow.
For every glance behind us, we have to look twice to the future.
For smart people, signs can replace words.
For the sake of the flowers, the weeds are watered.
Forget brotherhood, each goat will cost your seven dinars.
Forgetness is the plague of knowledge.
From you the money, from me the dance.
Further than Pleiades.
More silent than the earth.
More tame than a dog.
More tearful than an orphan.
More treacherous than a wolf.
More vicious than a snake.
More watchful than a dog.
Movement is a blessing.
My feet took me to my death.
My friends are like stars, pick one and it'll guide you.
Need excavates the trick.
He fasts and fasts, then he breaks his fast with an onion.
He fights with horns made of clay.
He fishes in unclear water.
He is the sunshine at the edge of the roof.
He kills the peacock for the beauty of its feathers.
He laughs most he who laughs last.
He makes a dome out of a grain. Meaning: He worries about a small problem as if it is a big one.
He makes a hundred knives, none of which has a handle.
He mixes Ramadan with Sha'ban. Meaning: He confuses the issue.
If destiny does not fit you, fit yourself to destiny.
If meat is expensive then patience is cheap.
if no agreement, then separation.
If not for religion, people would've killed each other.
If patience is sour then its result is sweet.
If talk is silver then silence is gold.
If the hair was precious, wouldn't grow on the ass.
If the heart is empty, the rest will soon abandon you too.
If the people wanted life, destiny better respond.
If the water is available you need not clean up with sand.
If you had an opinion you better be determined.
If you have no shame then do whatever you want.
If you hear a person talking good about things that aren't in you, don't be sure that he wouldn't also say bad things about things that aren't in you.
If you know then it's a disaster, and if you don't know then it's a greater disaster.
If you mentioned the wolf you better prepare the stick.
If you opress who is below you then you won't be safe from the punishment of who is above you.
If you reach for the highest of ideals, you shouldn't settle for less than the stars.
If you see the fangs of the lions, don't think the lion is smiling.
If you speak the word it shall own you, and if you don't you shall own it.
If you wanted obedience command with what is possible.
The devil is cunning.
The end of life is death.
The end of the grape cluster.
The end of the HONK is BEEP.
The envious person is a sad person.
The envious was created only to be infuriated.
People are for each other.
People are slaves to charity/ good deeds.
People don't thank someone who doesn't thank God.
People follow the religion/ ways of their kings.
People follow the winner.
People of the cave's slumber.
Pick the lesser of the two evils.
Plant each day and you will eat.
prepare for the evil dog a dog who's equal to it.
Protect your brother's privacy for what he knows of you.
Slower than a turtle.
Smart people are blessed.
Smoke of the neighbours renders you blind.
Smoother than breeze.
So many in the jail while innocent.
Some forgiveness is weakness.
Speak, for God spoke to Moses.
Stinginess demeans the value of man.
Stretch your legs according to the length of your kilim.
Stupidity is a disease without a medicine.
Every delay has its blessings.
Every disease has a medicine except for death.
Every person is observant to the flaws of others and blind to his own flaws.
Every son of Adam keeps hoping until he is carried away to his grave.
Evil in people does not go away when they get buried.
Evil is of old date.
Lying is the disease and truth is the cure.
Measure your quilt, then stretch your legs.
Meeting death is better than trying to ignore it.
Moderation in spending is half of all living.
Money finds money, water finds the puddle.
When you play, you may break your head.
When your son grows up, become his brother.
Wherever you go, the sky is the same color.
While the word is yet unspoken, you are master of it; when once it is spoken, it is master of you.
Who does not understand a look, cannot understand long explanations.
Winds blow counter to what ships desire.
Wiser than Loqman.
The neighbour comes before the home.
The one without a sword gets humiliated.
The onion of the beloved is a sheep.
The only more dear to you than your child, is your child's child.
The only trick the incapable has, are his tears.
The pebble comes from the mountain.
The person who pours water to other is the last one to drink.
The purest people are the ones with good manners.
The rope of lies is short.
It is the end of the shahnameh that is pleasant.
It may be a fire today, but tomorrow it will be only ashes.
It's a hardship that will go away.
It's as if she's fallen off an elephant's trunk.
Journey and you will find replacement to the ones left behind.
Keeping a secret is a commitment.
Kiils the victim and walks in his wake.
know your friend then leave him.
Laugh, and the world laughs with you; weep, and you weep alone.
What starts with a condition ends with out any oppression.
When a blind man dies, he is praised as having beautiful eyes.
When the reason is known, there will be no more shock.
When you are dead, your sister's tears will dry as time goes on, your widow's tears will cease in another's arms, but your mother will mourn you until she dies.
When you cannot bite a hand, kiss it.
When you mention 'dog,' you should get a stick.
Heavier than a mountain.
Higher than the heavens.
His fault is besides him.
How can the eater of dates forbid the eating of dates?
How great the grandfathers are, but how regretful what they left behind.
Human thinks and God plans.
Hunger is an infidel.
I complained because I had no shoes until I met a man who had no feet.
I cured my self but I amputated my nose in the process.
I got you, O! worshiper of the helper, to help me but you are in need of help.
The weapon first, fighting second.
The white penny will become useful in your dark days.
The wound that bleeds inwardly is the most dangerous.
They did not find a fault in the rose, they said O! you are red checked.
They planted so we ate, and we plant so they would eat.
Seek to get.
Self-praise is like chewing cotton wool.
Send a wise man and don't advise him.
Shall the sheep go astray, they will be led by the ill goat.
Silence is the sign of approval.
Similar to a bee: in their mouths they carry sweet honey, and in their tails poison.
Sit where you are welcomed and helped, and don't sit where you are not welcomed.
Like an ostrich: cannot fly and cannot bear burdens.
Like someone trying to capture water in his fist.
Like the man who shields himself with a spiders home.
Like the needle which clothes others while remaining naked.
Literal meaning: Cooking fat on honey.
Literal meaning: Give me long life and throw me in the sea.
Literal meaning: Give the dough to baker even if he eats half of it.
Literal meaning: He left the party without having Hommos.
Literal meaning: Save your white penny for your black day.
Literal meaning: The fisherman is the shark's friend.
Refers to people who are late in doing things.
Remind the youngster of his next life.
Rima came back to her old habits.
safer than the pigeon of Mekkah.
Said: What would the blind want�? Said: A bag of eyes.
Seek education even if it takes you to China.
Seek education from the cradle to the grave.
Seek knowledge from the cradle to the grave.
Unity is power.
Wait 'til your ass crosses the bridge.
Warmer than burning charcoal.
Watching what you say is your best friend.
We were silenced by our patience, he entered with his donkey.
Weaker than a spider's net.
Wealth comes like a turtle and goes away like a gazelle.
Went to Haj while pilgrims are coming back.
What can an old harlot do but repent of her misdeeds?
With carefulness you realize your opportunity.
With rapport and offsprings. Said to congratulate newlyweds.
Words of wisdom comes out of simple people mouths.
work for engagement of your daughter, but don't work for engagement of your son.
You are striking cold iron.
You can live without a brother but not without a friend.
You can smell his halvah.
You left them lost and bewildered.
The garlic said to the onion: 'you stink.'
The goat does not get fat just by whispering.
The greatest poorness is the lack of brains.
The horse knows its knight the best.
The idea came after the drunkness passed away.
The ideal phrase is that which is short and to the point.
The jar broke and the wine spilled.
Opinion comes before the bravery of the braves.
Oppose your affection to find rationality.
Our parents planted so we ate, and we plant for our children to eat.
Out of desperation he calls the cat 'madam'.
Outer beauty is no good, give me inner beauty.
Paradise is under mothers' feet.
Paradise without people is not worth living in..
People are enemies of that which they don't know.
People are equal like the teeth of a comb..
Suspicion is the sister of the wrong.
Take wisdom from the wise - not everyone who rides a horse is a jockey.
Thank who gives you and give who thanks you.
That is the lion's tail, do not play with it.
The ant shall never crawl on its knees.
The barking of dogs does not reduce the beggar's daily allotment.
The beginning of anger is madness and the end of it is regret.
The best answer comes from the man who isn't angry.
The best friend is the one who does not joke around.
You need a brother, without one you're like a person rushing to battle without a weapon.
You reap what you sow.
your brother is that who consoles you.
Your brother is who gives you a honest advice.
Your lord is the lord of hearts.
Your nose is a part of you even if it was cut.
Your relations are more deserving of your generosity.
Your secret is your captive.
Your tongue is like a horse--if you take care of it, it takes care of you; if you treat it badly, it treats you badly.
Your tongue is your horse� if you take care of it, it takes care of you; if you betray it, betrays it will.
The ropeman got mixed with the archer.
The secret to success is to walk forward.
The sky does not rain gold or silver.
The smarter you get the fewer words you'd say.
The son of a duck is a floater.
The stingy has a big porch and little morality.
The stone which cannot be lifted should be kissed.
The stupid might have wanted to help you, but ended up hurting you.
The village's piper does not exhilarate.
Needle in a haystack.
never let your tongue hit your neck.
No one says, 'my yogurt is sour.'
O! Count the waves of the sea Goha. Goha said the comings are more than what passed.
O! Count thy sheep Goha. Goha said one is asleep and the other is awake.
O! mother, the moon is at the door.
If you wish/ask, wish/ask for more.
if you're a liar, then have a good memory.
If you're a wind then I'm a twister.
If you're beautiful, whatever you do is fine.
If your house is of glass, don't throw rocks at others.
Ignorance is the death of the living.
Ignorance is the worst acquaintance.
In the desert of life the wise person travels by caravan, while the fool prefers to travel alone.
Ink on paper.
Inscribe science in writing.
too much modesty brings shame.
Tougher than a rock.
Tougher than a stone.
Translation: A friend is the one that lends a hand during the time of need.
Translation: Give the job to a person who knows how to perform it best even if it will cost you.
Translation: To get along very well.
Translation: To run out of patience.
Trust in Allah, but tie your camel first.
Two watermelons cannot be carried in one hand.
Uglier than magic.
O! my brother Flip the pot on its mouth, the daughters turn into their mums.
O! my sister close thy door, and enough what happened to you.
O! my sister that depend on men; you are believing in water in a sieve.
O! my sister Your son is like how you raised him. And your husband is like how you trained him.
O! You sitting, may God protect you from the evils of the comers.
Often, under the unseeing hide the cunning.
Oh hasty one, God will delay you.
Oh tyrant, your day will come.
Old age is a thousand headaches.
Old habits die hard.
the key to all things is determination.
The living is more important than the dead.
The man and his woman is like the grave and its dead.
The man who wanted to milk the male goat failed.
The mistake of the scientist leads to mistakes by many people.
The monkey in his mother's eye is a gazelle.
The most praised form of fluency is silence when talk isn't wise.
The mule was asked: "Who is your father?" It responded with: "The horse is my uncle."
Put things into their places, and they will put you into your place.
Rather a slip of the foot than a slip of the pen.
Rather the cruelty of the Turks than the justice of the Bedouins.
What is coming is better than what is gone
You need a brother, without one you’re like a person rushing to battle without a weapon
He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything
The fruit of silence is tranquility
A cat bitten once by a snake dreads even rope
Your brother is who gives you a honest advice
Silence is a brother of delight
When your son grows up, become his brother
A day lasts until it’s chased away but love lasts until the grave.
A little spark can kindle a great fire.
A man who was always complaining was quite rightly sent to hell. A man who was always complaining was quite rightly sent to hell. "Why are you burning damp wood?" was his first comment.
A man’s worth depends on his two smallest organs: his heart and his tongue.
A scholar’s ink is worth as much as the blood of the martyr.
A small house is enough room for a thousand friends.
A tree that affords thee shade, do not order it to be cut down.
A wise man’s day is worth a fool’s life.
A woman’s belly is a garden with many kinds of fruit.
A woman’s mosque is her home.
All authors should prepare to encounter criticism.
Another man’s bread will not fill your belly.
Ask for your wife’s advice and then do the opposite.
Ask thy purse what thou should’st buy.
Ask your purse what you should buy.
Avoid that which requires an apology.
Avoid the company of a liar. And if you can’t avoid him, don’t believe him.
Avoiding mistakes is better than apologizing after.
Beauty doesn’t exist, men only dream it.
Benefits make a man a slave.
Birds align with grain, but not with the stick.
Blindness of the eye is better than blindness of the heart.
Build with silver and cover with gold.
By his own mouth does the liar expose himself.
Call someone your lord and he’ll sell you in the slave market.
Choose the neighbor before the house.
Compete, don’t envy.
Death is a black camel which kneels at every man’s gate.
Do not drink poison to quench a thirst.
Don’t celebrate someone’s departing unless you know who will succeed him.
Don’t pour away your water on the strength of a mirage.
Don’t think you are eloquent just because a fool applauds you.
Dwell among people for forty days. You will either become one of them or flee them.
Every village has certain drawbacks to it.
Everything forbidden is desirable.
Family means no one gets left behind or forgotten.
Four things come not back – the spoken word, the sped arrow, the past life, and the neglected opportunity.
Give a man some cloth and he’ll ask for some lining.
God bless him who pays visits – short visits.
God sells knowledge for labor – honor for risk.
Have faith in a stone and you will be healed by it.
He gets his passage for nothing and then winks at the captain’s wife.
He hit me, started to cry, and went straight to the judge to sue me
He makes a dome out of a grain.
He that counts his friend’s mistakes will be abandoned by him.
He who does not shield himself from vilification receives it.
He who peeps at the neighbor’s window may chance to lose his eyes.
Heaven on earth is to be found on horseback, reading books and between a woman’s breasts.
Hit the iron while it’s still hot.
How can the person who is eating dates prohibit the eating of dates?
I came to the place of my birth and cried, I came to the place of my birth and cried, "The friends of my youth, where are they?" And echo answered, "Where are they?"
If a dog offers to help you across the river, don’t ask if he is suffering from the mange.
If a man’s mouth were silent, then another part would speak.
If a rich man eats a snake, people call it wisdom; if a poor man does the same thing, people call it derangement.
If anyone is not willing to accept your point of view, try to see his point of view.
If man’s mouth was silent, then another part would speak.
If the wind blows, ride it.
If you buy cheap meat, you’ll smell what you have saved when it boils.
If you conduct yourself properly, then fear no one.
If you count your friend’s mistakes, he will desert you.
If you do charity, your house will be always rich.
If you don’t know where you are going, look back to where you’ve come from.
If you have an opinion, you better be determined.
If you’re a liar, you better have a good memory.
If your motive is good, a farting donkey won’t harm you.
In every village, there is a path that leads to the mill.
Insults should be written in the sand, and praises carved in stone.
It may be a fire today – tomorrow it will be ashes.
It’s all fate and chance.
It’s better to be a free dog than a caged lion.
It’s better to have a thousand enemies outside of the tent than one inside the tent.
Keep away from trouble and sing to it.
Lack of intelligence is the greatest poverty.
Laugh and the world laughs with you; weep, and you weep alone.
Leading by example is better than commandments.
Live near water, and ask not about sustenance.
Look and keep silent, and if you are eating meat, tell the world it’s fish.
Love overlooks defects; hatred magnifies them.
Lower your voice and strengthen your argument.
Lying is a disease, and truth is a cure.
Many wars have been caused by a single word.
Meeting death is better than escaping from it.
Mustaches hide the imperfections of the mouth.
My family is my strength and my weakness.
Never celebrate someone’s leaving, until you know who will succeed him.
Never sit in the place of a man who can say to you, Never sit in the place of a man who can say to you, "Rise.".
No good can come of one who has never kept a friendship.
Nobody is perfect.
Play alone and you’re bound to win.
Setting the conditions before you make an agreement is better than having an argument in the middle of the work.
Shall the gosling teach the goose to swim?.
Shallow waters mak’ maist din.
Silence is the best answer to the stupid.
Some men build a wine cellar after only finding one grape.
Sometimes you need to sacrifice your beard in order to save your head.
Start seeking knowledge from the cradle up to the grave.
Take wisdom from the wise – not everyone who rides a horse is a jockey.
The barber learns to shave on the orphan’s face.
The best gift comes from the heart.
The envious person is the least happy.
The fire is winter’s fruit.
The garlic complained to the onion, "You stink!"
The ink of a scholar is worth as much as the martyr’s blood.
The key to everything is determination.
The liar’s mother is a virgin.
The man with no patience waits for daylight, and when it comes he’ll be blind.
The one who should be forgiven, is the one who’s able to punish.
The person who deals in camels should make the doors high.
The person who knew you when you were young will seldom respect you as an adult.
There has to be a first time for everything – even our most natural habits.
There is no fire without smoke.
They have sowed the seed of the word They have sowed the seed of the word "tomorrow" and it has not germinated.
Time is like a sword. If you do not cut it, it will cut you.
To the pure, all things are pure.
Trust God, but tie up your camel.
Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
When the judge’s mule dies, everyone goes to the funeral; when the judge himself dies, no one does.
When what you want doesn’t happen, learn to want what does.
When you die, your sister’s tears will dry as time goes on, your widow’s tears will end in another’s arms, but your mother will mourn you until the day she dies.
When you love someone, you love the person as they are, and not as you’d like them to be.
When you return from a trip, bring back something for your family—even if it is only a stone.
Whoever knew you when you were small will not respect you when you’re big.
Wisdom consists of ten parts – nine parts of silence and one part with few words.
You can’t clap with one hand.
You will discover your true friends in moments of crisis.
You won’t gain knowledge by drinking ink.
Examine what is said, not who speaks.
Your tongue is like a horse – if you take care of it, it takes care of you; if you treat it badly, it treats you badly.
Throw a resourceful man into a river, and he’ll probably come out with a fish in his hand.
If you stop every time a dog barks, then your road will never end.
If man’s mouth were silent, then another part would speak.
How can the eater of dates prohibit the eating of dates?
Don’t pour away your water due to a mirage.
May your left ear wither and fall into your right pocket.
Silence is medication for sorrow.
The horse is god’s gift to mankind.
Lie to a liar, for lies are his coin; Steal from a thief, for that is easy; lay a trap for a trickster and catch him at first attempt, but beware of an honest man.
It may be a fire today — tomorrow it will be ashes.
When fate arrives the physician becomes a fool.
The whispers of a pretty girl can be heard further than the roar of a lion.
Wisdom consists of ten parts: nine parts silence and one part a few words.
Talents without skills is like deserts without an oasis.
Better to have a thousand enemies outside of the tent than one inside the tent.
A mule who goes in search of a fine set of antlers, will come back with his ears cut off!
I am a prince and you are a prince; who will lead the donkeys?
Your tongue is like a horse — if you take care of it, it takes care of you; if you treat it badly, it treats you badly.
A good horse has many faults; a bad one has hardly any.
arabian.category: croatian proverb the horse is god’s gift to mankind. ~ arabian

arabian.text: Wisdom consists of ten parts — nine parts of silence and one part with few words.
Doubt is the key to knowledge.
God sells knowledge for labor — honor for risk.
Choose your neighbors before your house and your companions before the road.
God bless him who pays visits — short visits.
Words from the heart reach the heart; words from the mouth reach the ear.
There has to be a first time for everything — even our most natural habits.
Fortune is with you for an hour and against you for ten!
Four things come not back. The spoken word, the sped arrow, the past life, ad the neglected opportunity.
Spirit is the sword and experience is the sharpening stone.
Measure your guilt, and then stretch your legs.
Paradise can be found on the back of horses, in books and between the breasts of women
Kiss the hand of your enemy if you cannot chop it off.
The fruit of silence is tranquillity.
He, who walks through a field of onions, will smell like an onion.
The garlic complained to the onion, "You stink!
If beggings hould unfortunately be your lot, knock at the large gates only.
To threaten the brave with death is like promising water to a duck.
Only death itself can end our hope.
Death was afraid of him because he had the heart of a lion.
Death rides a fast camel.
Death is a black camel that lies down at every door. Sooner or later you must ride the camel.
Those who argue with each other on the highway will often make up in the lane.
Everything is small at the beginning and then grows; except trouble, which is big at the beginning and still grows.
He that counts his friend’s mistakes will be abandoned by him.
A known mistake is better than an unknown truth.
Your friend will swallow your mistakes; your enemy will present them on a plate.
The grave is our mother.
Your friend will swallow your mistakes; your enemy will present them on a plate.
Luck is the residue of design.
A mule who goes in search of a fine set of antlers, will come back with his ears cut off
Every head has its own headache.
Fortune is with you for an hour and against you for ten!
He who has health has hope; and he who has hope has everything.
If you give in to a fool, he will say, "This is because they are afraid of me.
To call a man a thief gives him the right to be one.
arabian.description: Treating someone in an unfair or cruel way will ensure a similar behaviour from them in the future.
